title: Fragment, 6th–10th century
medium:
Medium: wool
Technique: compound complementary warps: 2/1 twill
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 29.5 x 5.8 cm (11 5/8 x 2 5/16 in.)
description: Long fragment, horizontal pattern of two striding lions, green on red, confronted on either side of a conical tree or flower, red on green. The tree and lion groupings are separated by a geometric motif resembling four anchors radiating from a larger central anchor. Bordered on top and bottom by narrow bands of square and x-pattern design in dark blue and buff.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, 6th–10th century.Medium: wool
Technique: compound complementary warps: 2/1 twill. 1959-105-13.
